meanings.definition: Having a wavy or winding form
meanings.sent1: The sinuate road led us through the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The river had a sinuate path through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The sinuate pattern on the fabric made it look elegant.
meanings.sent4: Her sinuate dance moves captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The sinuate branches of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To make something have a wavy or winding form
meanings.sent1: She used a tool to sinuate the edges of the paper.
meanings.sent2: The artist sinuated the lines to create a sense of movement.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally sinuated the wire while trying to straighten it.
meanings.sent4: The wind sinuated the sand dunes over time.
meanings.sent5: The potter sinuated the clay into a beautiful vase.
